channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report E-2023080146
item.description:
Report E-2023080146

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: NORTH HUNTINGDON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XPB experienced a UN1993 Tyzor IAM release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released impacting a 5' x 5' area of the concrete dock floor and an 8' x 1' area of the trailer floor due to a pinhole puncture. Oil dri and simple green were utilized to clean the impacted areas and then collected into a 55-gallon metal drum. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Large box wet with gasoline delivered to damages area DescribePack: This is a lawn mower return which leaked gasoline from its fuel tank. Tank lid missing, Outer box torn apart and wet with liquid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package moved to Hazmat holding cage on skid, excess leakage absorbed with shop towels.

item.title: Report X-2023080302
item.description:
Report X-2023080302

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-22
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of power liquid liquid machine detergent one 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap leaking allowing .25 gallons to release package did have slotted partitions but no bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found on the truck punctured at the bottom of the jerrican. The hazmat did spill but the spillage was covered in neutralizing powder. The hazmat was then placed into a bin to stop leakage and put into the damage hazmat cage. DescribePack: The package was punctured at the bottom by a sharp object on the truck. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The was placed into a bin to stop leakage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking by a package handler during the unload. Preload manager bagged and brought package to QA to be processed. DescribePack: The closure of the bag appears ok, but it was wet around the lid and there was definite leakage. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed with the arrows up into a hazmat processing tote.

item.title: Report E-2023080014
item.description:
Report E-2023080014

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: PITTSBURGH
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAQ experienced a UN3105 NOROX MEKP-9 release from boxes containing (4) 1-quart poly bottles. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-gallons of product released to a 6' x 4' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. A total of (24) 1-quart poly bottles were found damaged and placed into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. Absorbents and sodium bicarb were used to clean the impacted area and then collected along with all impacted cardboard into an additional (3) 55-gallon vented poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023080193
item.description:
Report X-2023080193

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHEN THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS LOADING IT IN THE TRAILER IT WAS STRUCK ON THE CORNER OF THE ROLLERS CAUSING A PUNCTURE AND IT LEAK OUT. THE LOADSIDE MANAGER CALLED QA, WE CAME WITH A TOTE AND SPILL PADS. AND IT WAS PLACED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE DescribePack: DURING LOADING THE CONTAINER STRUCK THE CORNER OF THE METAL ROLLERS. THIS CAUSED A GASH IN THE CONTAINER CAUSING IT TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: THE CANISTER WAS PUT IN A TOTE AND PLACED ON ITS SIDE.
